title: Code of Conduct
intro: Hack4Change is committed to providing a welcoming, inclusive, and harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion (or lack thereof), or technology choices.

standards.title: Our Standards
standards.intro: We expect all participants, sponsors, mentors, judges, volunteers, and organizers to:
items: Be respectful and considerate in speech and actions
Communicate professionally and constructively
Be collaborative and supportive of fellow participants
Respect differing viewpoints and experiences
Gracefully accept constructive criticism
Focus on what is best for the community
Show empathy towards other community members

unacceptable.title: Unacceptable Behavior
unacceptable.intro: The following behaviors are unacceptable at Hack4Change:
items: Harassment, intimidation, or discrimination in any form
Offensive comments related to gender, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, race, ethnicity, or religion
Inappropriate physical contact or unwelcome sexual attention
Deliberate intimidation, stalking, or following
Sustained disruption of talks, workshops, or other event activities
Publication of others' private information without consent
Advocating for, or encouraging, any of the above behaviors

scope.title: Scope
scope.intro: This Code of Conduct applies to:
items: All Hack4Change event spaces (physical and digital)
Official event communications (email, chat platforms)
Social events associated with Hack4Change
Representing Hack4Change in public spaces

reporting.title: Reporting
reporting.intro: If you experience or witness unacceptable behavior:

steps.title: Immediate Safety Concerns:
steps.description: If you feel unsafe, contact venue security or call 911

steps.title: Code of Conduct Violations:
steps.description: Report to any Hack4Change organizer in person, or email contact@hack4change.ca with "Code of Conduct" in the subject line

reporting.confidentiality: All reports will be handled with discretion and confidentiality. We will protect the identity of reporters unless required by law.

whatToInclude.title: What to include in your report:
items: Your contact information (for follow-up)
Names of any individuals involved
Description of the incident, including date/time/location
Whether the incident is ongoing
Any additional context or witnesses

enforcement.title: Enforcement
enforcement.intro: Organizers will review all reports and determine appropriate action, which may include:
actions: Requiring the offender to avoid the reporter
Expulsion from the event with no refund (if applicable)
Banning from future Civic Tech Moncton events
Contacting venue security or local law enforcement
enforcement.priority: Our priority is the safety and comfort of all participants. We will take all reports seriously and respond promptly.

attribution.title: Attribution
attribution.text: This Code of Conduct is adapted from codes used by civic tech communities across North America, including Code for Canada and Civic Tech Toronto, which are based on the Conference Code of Conduct.
